contentrichtext.text: <!--Low priority for [[WP:CUE]], but we may get around to it eventually.--> [[File:Bumper pool table.jpg|right|thumb|200px|Rectangular bumper pool table]] '''Bumper pool''' is a [[Pocket (billiards)|pocket billiards]] game played on an [[octagon]]al or [[Rectangle|rectangular]] table fitted with an array of fixed cushioned obstacles, called bumpers, at the center of its surface.<ref name="bw-bump" /><ref name="bptf" /> == Table == Typically bumper pool tables are smaller than a regulation [[Billiard table#Pocket_billiards_.28pool.29_tables|pool table]].<ref name="bptf" /><ref name="bpt-home"/> The table has two pockets, placed opposite one another, located at the center of two of the rails.<ref name="bptf" /> Most tables have twelve bumpers, although some tables have fourteen or sixteen.<ref name="bptf" /><ref name="bpt-home"/> Two bumpers flank each pocket.<ref name="bptf" /> The remaining bumpers are arranged in a cross in the center of the table, with one line of the cross in line with the pockets.<ref name="bptf" /> At the center of the cross, there is an open space just large enough to allow a ball to pass through. Tables with fourteen bumpers have three rather than two bumpers on each side of the center space on the line midway between the two holes.<ref name="bptf" /> == Gameplay == The game is played with 5 red and 5 white [[Billiard ball|balls]], with one marked ball in each set.<ref name="bw-bump" /><ref name="bptf" /><ref name="bpt-rules"/> At the start of play, each set of balls is arranged on five spots near each edge of the table by a [[Pocket (billiards)|pocket]] with the marked ball placed directly in front of the [[Pocket (billiards)|pocket]].<ref name="bptf" /> The object is for a player to sink all of their balls into their [[Pocket (billiards)|pocket]] at the opposite end of the table.<ref name="bptf" /><ref name="bpt-rules"/> A player's marked ball must be sunk before the player can sink any other balls.<ref name="bptf" /><ref name="bpt-rules"/> Unlike most other billiard games, there is no designated [[cue ball]]: each ball can be shot into the [[Pocket (billiards)|pocket]].<ref name="bw-bump" /><ref name="bptf" /> To begin play, both players shoot their marked ball simultaneously, [[Glossary_of_cue_sports_terms#bank_shot|banking]] the ball off the cushion to their right and attempting to sink their ball in their [[Pocket (billiards)|pocket]] at the other end of the table.<ref name="bw-bump" /><ref name="bptf" /> If both players sink their first shot they each select another ball, place it in front of their opponent's [[Pocket (billiards)|pocket]], and repeat the simultaneous shot.<ref name="bw-bump" /><ref name="bptf" /> If both players successfully sink all five of their balls in this fashion the game ends in a [[Tie (draw)|draw]].<ref name="bw-bump" /><ref name="bptf" /> If, on the initial simultaneous shot, one player fails to sink his or her marked ball in the [[Pocket (billiards)|pocket]], the player who successfully sank a ball or who came closest to his or her own pocket shoots next. A player's turn continues until he or she fails to sink a ball. == Fouls == If a player sinks one of the opponent's balls there is no penalty. However, the ball is considered sunk regardless of which [[Pocket (billiards)|pocket]] it drops in. If a player sinks one of his own balls (but not the last) in their opponent's [[Pocket (billiards)|pocket]], the opponent may drop two balls into their pocket.<ref name="bptf" /> A player sinking their last ball in the wrong pocket loses the game.<ref name="bptf" /> If a player causes a ball to leave the table, their opponent may place that ball anywhere on the table (usually in the middle space surrounded by bumpers) and may (depending on local custom<ref name="bptf" />) drop two of their balls into their [[Pocket (billiards)|pocket]].<ref name="bw-bump" /><ref name="bptf" /><ref name="bpt-rules"/> ==References== {{reflist|refs= <ref name="bw-bump">{{cite web |url=http://www.billiardworld.com/bumppool.html |title=BUMPER POOL |work=Billiard World Magazine |accessdate=25 January 2010}} </ref> <ref name="bpt-rules">{{cite web |url=http://www.bumper-pool-tables.com/rules.html |title=Bumper Pool Rules |work=Bumper Pool Tables vendor site |publisher=Bumper Pool Tables |accessdate=25 January 2010}}</ref> <ref name="bpt-home">{{cite web |url=http://www.bumper-pool-tables.com/ |title=Bumper Pool Table |work=Bumper Pool Tables vendor site |publisher=Bumper Pool Tables |accessdate=25 January 2010}}</ref> <ref name="bptf">{{cite web |url=http://bumperpooltablefacts.com/bumperpooltableballs.html |title=Sinking Bumper Pool Table Balls By the Rules |work= Bumper Pool Table Facts |accessdate=25 January 2010}}</ref> }} ==External links== * http://www.billiardworld.com/bumppool.html * [http://www.bumper-pool-tables.com/rules.html Bumper Pool Rules] {{Cue sports nav}} [[Category:Obstacle billiards]]
